headline: Watch: The best and worst jokes from the jam-packed White House Correspondents' Dinner  Biden needles Trump and DeSantis
author: Paul Sacca
sentences:
The "Daily Show" host highlighted the media's hypocrisy on COVID-19 precautions, "You guys spent the last two years telling everyone the importance of wearing masks and avoiding large indoor gatherings, then the second someone offers you a free dinner, you all turn into Joe Rogan.?
"I mean, Dr. Fauci dropped out," the comedian continued.

The president then said that if Trump had attended the event, it would have been a "real coup"  a joke about the Jan. 6 riot, which Biden previously called an "armed insurrection" on a day that "democracy was attacked."

Biden noted that the 2022 White House Correspondents' Dinner was the first time a sitting U.S. president attended the event since 2016 because former President Donald Trump boycotted the WHCD during his presidency.

"pic.twitter.com/ajwVYmQ5Ga
 Mary Margaret Olohan (@Mary Margaret Olohan) 1651371651
Trevor Noah began his monologue by calling out the hypocrisy of press members attending a packed indoor event.
The WHCD  which is also referred to as the "nerd prom"  began with a video of a pre-recorded skit with "Late Late Show" host James Corden filling in for White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki.

Where is Chris Cuomo, by the way, is he here??
The Comedy Central talk show host skewered Jen Psaki about joining MSNBC, "When Trump was in office, your show was all about how bad he was.
"Some people think that this [dinner] shows that the media is too cozy with politicians, but what those people dont understand is that you guys have integrity," Noah said.

"\n\n#WHCD #WHCD2022 #nerdprompic.twitter.com/jSeUCGrUE5
 CSPAN (@CSPAN) 1651371312
Biden took aim at possible 2024 GOP presidential candidate and current Florida Gov.
"Interesting fact: Even as first lady Dr. Biden continued her teaching career, the first time a presidential spouse has ever done so," he said of Jill Biden.
Corden is most concerned about President Biden's opinion on the budding romance between Kim Kardashian and Pete Davidson  who were in attendance at the WHCD.
Noah mocked the president for the historic inflation that is causing financial ruin for Americans  which garnered laughter from the audience and Biden.
At least 72 people who attended the event tested positive for COVID-19, including Attorney General Merrick Garland and New York City Mayor Eric Adams.
The packed indoor event at the Washington Hilton was hosted by "Daily Show" host Trevor Noah, and attended by journalists, politicos, and celebrities.
Biden then took the podium and addressed his dismal approval rating by giving "a special thanks to the 42% of you who actually applauded."
Psaki provides Corden with talking points for his White House press conference  such as "War with Russia: bad," and "CDC: good."
Now, you might think it's because she loves teaching so much, but its actually because she's still paying off her student debt.

Nothing??
Noah is referencing the corporate media dinner held last month that even MSNBC labeled as a "superspreader event."
Noah needled former CNN anchor Chris Cuomo and his cozy on-air relationship with his older brother  former New York Gov.
"You would never allow personal connections to affect your ability to be good journalists  isnt that right Chris Cuomo.
While flubbing Ronald Regan's iconic "tear down this wall" speech from 1987, Biden declared, "Ronald Reagan said, 'Mr.
"Fauci thought it was too dangerous to come tonight," Noah stated, before adding, "Pete Davidson thought it was okay.
"It is my great honor to be speaking tonight at the nation's most distinguished superspreader event," Noah stated.
To conclude the festivities, Noah took a parting shot at Biden's tumultuous withdrawal from Afghanistan.
He then mocked journalists as the "only group of Americans with a lower approval rating than I have."
Besides, there's nothing I can say about the GOP that Kevin McCarthy hasn't already put on tape."
Ron DeSantis over his handling of Disney's fight against the Parental Rights in Education law.
And pretty soon they\u2019ll be storming Cinderella's castle, and you can be sure of it.
The White House Correspondents Dinner took place in Washington, D.C., on Saturday night.
"This is the first time a president has attended this dinner in six years," Biden said.
Washington Post reporter Jada Yuan said the jam-packed room is "like a horror film."
And pretty soon theyll be storming Cinderella's castle, and you can be sure of it."
We all know this administration doesn't handle evacuations well," Noah signed off.
"It's understandable, we had a horrible plague followed by two years of COVID."
"Ever since you've come into office things are really looking up," Noah began.
President Biden: "We had a horrible plague followed by two years of COVID.
You can watch the entire 2022 White House Correspondents' Dinner below.
President Joe Biden and first lady Jill Biden were also in attendance.
The president acknowledged the anti-Biden slogan "Let's go Brandon."
And now Biden is in office, your show is about how bad Trump was."
"Literally getting trapped between tables," Yuan wrote on Twitter.
Noah lambasted the press, "Do you read any of your own newspapers?
Creeping sense that youre the only one who know this is insane."
I mean, I expect this out of Sean Hannity, but the rest of you?
Biden then insinuated that the Trump presidency was a "plague."
Today\u2019s Republicans say, tear down Mickey Mouse's house!
This was the first WHCD since 2020 because of the pandemic.
Todays Republicans say, 'Tear down Mickey Mouse's house!'
"Fear of breathing near people but people are everywhere.
Did none of you learn anything from the Gridiron dinner?
"Republicans seem to support one fellow," Biden said.
Biden then quipped, "I'm not here to roast the GOP.
Yeah, I guess you should've voted for Bernie."
President Biden: "Ronald Reagan said, 'Mr.
"That should have been a pretty big sign."
"Please be careful leaving tonight.
"For real, what are we doing here?
Gorbachev, tear this wall down!'
He's having a really good year.
And I'm kind of happy for him."
Gorbachev, tear this wall down!
I'm sorry about that, Jill.
And we all went with Pete.
What are you doing here?
"Some guy named Brandon.
That's not my style.
"Congratulations.
Alright then."
Andrew Cuomo.
Everything."
"Gas is up.
Rent is up.
Food is up.
